\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+getopt(apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t $\ast$os, const char $\ast$opts, char $\ast$option\+\_\+ch, const char $\ast$$\ast$option\+\_\+arg)}{apr_getopt(apr_getopt_t *os, const char *opts, char *option_ch, const char **option_arg)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+getopt (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{os, }
\item[{const char $\ast$}]{opts, }
\item[{char $\ast$}]{option\+\_\+ch, }
\item[{const char $\ast$$\ast$}]{option\+\_\+arg}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__getopt_ga289cdcf7eacc997eb91fea7c02d08934}{}\label{group__apr__getopt_ga289cdcf7eacc997eb91fea7c02d08934}
Parse the options initialized by \hyperlink{group__apr__getopt_gaaab2b4bfb62361af7a2d427f5f29a3d4}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init()}. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em os} & The apr\+\_\+opt\+\_\+t structure returned by \hyperlink{group__apr__getopt_gaaab2b4bfb62361af7a2d427f5f29a3d4}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init()} \\
\hline
{\em opts} & A string of characters that are acceptable options to the program. Characters followed by \char`\"{}\+:\char`\"{} are required to have an option associated \\
\hline
{\em option\+\_\+ch} & The next option character parsed \\
\hline
{\em option\+\_\+arg} & The argument following the option character\+: \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
There are four potential status values on exit. They are\+: 
\begin{DoxyPre}
            APR\_EOF      --  No more options to parse
            APR\_BADCH    --  Found a bad option character
            APR\_BADARG   --  No argument followed the option flag
            APR\_SUCCESS  --  The next option was found.
\end{DoxyPre}
 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\index{Command Argument Parsing@{Command Argument Parsing}!apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init@{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init}}
\index{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init@{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init}!Command Argument Parsing@{Command Argument Parsing}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init(apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t $\ast$$\ast$os, apr\+\_\+pool\+\_\+t $\ast$cont, int argc, const char $\ast$const $\ast$argv)}{apr_getopt_init(apr_getopt_t **os, apr_pool_t *cont, int argc, const char *const *argv)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t} $\ast$$\ast$}]{os, }
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+pool\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{cont, }
\item[{int}]{argc, }
\item[{const char $\ast$const $\ast$}]{argv}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__getopt_gaaab2b4bfb62361af7a2d427f5f29a3d4}{}\label{group__apr__getopt_gaaab2b4bfb62361af7a2d427f5f29a3d4}
Initialize the arguments for parsing by \hyperlink{group__apr__getopt_ga289cdcf7eacc997eb91fea7c02d08934}{apr\+\_\+getopt()}. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em os} & The options structure created for \hyperlink{group__apr__getopt_ga289cdcf7eacc997eb91fea7c02d08934}{apr\+\_\+getopt()} \\
\hline
{\em cont} & The pool to operate on \\
\hline
{\em argc} & The number of arguments to parse \\
\hline
{\em argv} & The array of arguments to parse \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
Arguments 3 and 4 are most commonly argc and argv from main(argc, argv) The ($\ast$os)-\/$>$errfn is initialized to fprintf(stderr... but may be overridden. 
\end{DoxyRemark}
\index{Command Argument Parsing@{Command Argument Parsing}!apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+long@{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+long}}
\index{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+long@{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+long}!Command Argument Parsing@{Command Argument Parsing}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+long(apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t $\ast$os, const apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+option\+\_\+t $\ast$opts, int $\ast$option\+\_\+ch, const char $\ast$$\ast$option\+\_\+arg)}{apr_getopt_long(apr_getopt_t *os, const apr_getopt_option_t *opts, int *option_ch, const char **option_arg)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+long (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{os, }
\item[{const {\bf apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+option\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{opts, }
\item[{int $\ast$}]{option\+\_\+ch, }
\item[{const char $\ast$$\ast$}]{option\+\_\+arg}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__getopt_ga80d6ff2213da4e25406b3f179fa13989}{}\label{group__apr__getopt_ga80d6ff2213da4e25406b3f179fa13989}
Parse the options initialized by \hyperlink{group__apr__getopt_gaaab2b4bfb62361af7a2d427f5f29a3d4}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init()}, accepting long options beginning with \char`\"{}-\/-\/\char`\"{} in addition to single-\/character options beginning with \char`\"{}-\/\char`\"{}. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em os} & The \hyperlink{structapr__getopt__t}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+t} structure created by \hyperlink{group__apr__getopt_gaaab2b4bfb62361af7a2d427f5f29a3d4}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+init()} \\
\hline
{\em opts} & A pointer to a list of \hyperlink{structapr__getopt__option__t}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+option\+\_\+t} structures, which can be initialized with \{ \char`\"{}name\char`\"{}, optch, has\+\_\+args \}. has\+\_\+args is nonzero if the option requires an argument. A structure with an optch value of 0 terminates the list. \\
\hline
{\em option\+\_\+ch} & Receives the value of \char`\"{}optch\char`\"{} from the \hyperlink{structapr__getopt__option__t}{apr\+\_\+getopt\+\_\+option\+\_\+t} structure corresponding to the next option matched. \\
\hline
{\em option\+\_\+arg} & Receives the argument following the option, if any. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
There are four potential status values on exit. They are\+: 
\begin{DoxyPre}
            APR\_EOF      --  No more options to parse
            APR\_BADCH    --  Found a bad option character
            APR\_BADARG   --  No argument followed the option flag
            APR\_SUCCESS  --  The next option was found.
\end{DoxyPre}
 When A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+S\+U\+C\+C\+E\+SS is returned, os-\/$>$ind gives the index of the first non-\/option argument. On error, a message will be printed to stdout unless os-\/$>$err is set to 0. If os-\/$>$interleave is set to nonzero, options can come after arguments, and os-\/$>$argv will be permuted to leave non-\/option arguments at the end (the original argv is unaffected). 
\end{DoxyReturn}
